meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a peg.
meanings.sent1: She was pegging the clothes on the line.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys pegging the tent stakes into the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was pegging acorns in the tree for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was pegging the vines to the trellis with care.
meanings.sent5: Pegging the papers together made them easier to organize.

meanings.definition: To mark or indicate with pegs.
meanings.sent1: They were pegging the route with colorful flags.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor was pegging the boundaries of the property.
meanings.sent3: The children were pegging their favorite spots on the map.
meanings.sent4: She was pegging the locations of the hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: Pegging the path with signs helped hikers find their way.

meanings.definition: A method of securing or fastening with pegs.

meanings.sent2: The traditional chair was built using pegging techniques.
meanings.sent3: The old cabinet's strength came from the pegging construction.

meanings.sent5: The table's durability was enhanced by the pegging method.
